The Minnesota State High School League has voted on fall sports participation. To sum up their actions:
Soccer (boys and girls), Cross Country (boys and girls), girls tennis and girls swim/dive will take place this fall, with a cutback to schedules, no scrimmaging, and a shortened season.
The MSHSL board voted to move volleyball and football to a so-called "third season" which would take place March-May.
More information will be coming from our activities directors and ISD 728 staff when we have details from MSHSL.

Application deadline is Friday, July 31, 2020.

Thanks Bart Engvall for bringing some “positoovity” during these difficult times.

He wrote, “Hey all! So as all probably know, we had to cancel our spring production because of COVID-19. Many of us are sad because we have put in so much time and effort into this show. If you didn’t know, I was supposed to play Scuttle in our production. Scuttle gets to sing a little song called Positoovity in the show, which encourages Ariel to conquer her fears and stay positive. I felt that amidst of all the sadness and negativity in our world currently, everyone could use a little “Positoovity”, so I decided to share the makeup I was supposed to wear (and totally botched, sorry Kaytlin), and my first verse of my song (let’s just say maybe I could have used a few more singing practices) to remind you all that even though things may get tough and we will want to give up, we need to remember that silly little word to keep our hopes up and push forward in a scary time.”

ICYMI: The ISD 728 Health Services team sent out the following message in our most recent school newsletters regarding COVID-19, the current strain of Coronavirus -

Families:

We’re in the middle of flu season and we’re also tracking available information about the emerging and quickly spreading coronavirus.

At ISD 728, we follow guidance from the Minnesota Department of Health. The available information about coronavirus suggests a low immediate health risk for the general public and the guidance at this point is to take the same precautions recommended for avoiding colds and flu.

Minnesota Department of Health advises people to:
1. Stay home when they are sick
2. Cover their cough
3. Practice good hand washing

We reinforce these practices at school - for our students and staff - and invite you to do the same with students at home. If you have questions, feel free to contact your school health office.
